questions.question: ……………………… jeered at the thief.
questions.description: When a pronoun is the subject of the verb, we use the nominative form.

questions.question: There was no way for ……………………….. to escape.
questions.description: The object form of the pronoun is used after a preposition.

questions.question: Between you and …………………………, I don’t trust him.
questions.description: The object form of the pronoun is used after a preposition.

questions.question: Suddenly an idea struck ………………………….
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a verb should be in the object form.

questions.question: The deer looked at …………………………… reflection in the water.
questions.description: Its is a possessive word like his or her.

questions.question: You could have killed ………………………….
questions.description: When the subject and object refer to the same person, the reflexive pronoun is used for the object.

questions.question: Prospero assured ………………………….. that ………………………… ship was safely anchored.
She told ………………………….. that …………………….. had passed the test.
